item.title: DTV Transition For Wireless Mic Users
item.description: The U.S. is in the middle of transitioning to digital television, a process that began on February 17th and will continue until June 12th. This shift brings significant changes for many wireless microphone users, potentially disrupting their ability to operate. The transition, often called the DTV transition, signifies a complete reallocation of VHF and UHF frequencies that have been used for over-the-air television broadcasting for the past five decades. While the main goal is to switch from analog to digital broadcasting, the implications extend far beyond this.
